sentences: My father has trouble remembering things.
Sometimes he forgets names or dates.
He also gets confused about where he is.
Last week, we went to the hospital.
We visited the memory clinic on the 3rd floor.
A kind nurse welcomed us at the front desk.
She asked my father some simple questions.
Then the doctor came and did some memory tests.
My father had to remember three words and repeat them.
He also drew a clock and wrote the numbers.
After the tests, the doctor spoke to us.
He said it might be early-stage dementia.
He told us not to worry too much.
The doctor gave us advice on how to help my father.
He said we should keep a daily routine.
He also said we should talk to him gently and clearly.
Before we left, my father smiled and said thank you.
It was a long day, but I was glad we went.
korean: 또한 자신이 어디에 있는지 헷갈려 하신다.
그 다음 의사 선생님이 와서 기억력 검사를 하셨다.
아버지는 세 단어를 기억하고 반복해야 했다.
또한 시계를 그리고 숫자를 써야 했다.
검사 후, 의사 선생님이 우리에게 말했다.
아버지를 도울 수 있는 방법도 알려주셨다.
우리가 떠나기 전, 아버지는 미소를 지으며 감사하다고 하셨다.
explanations: Simple present tense to describe an ongoing condition.
'Sometimes' shows frequency; verb 'forgets' in present tense.
Use of 'gets confused' to show emotional/cognitive state.
Simple past tense for a past event.
'Visited' in past tense; location phrase with 'on the 3rd floor'.
Past tense verb 'welcomed'; preposition 'at the front desk'.
Past tense with 'asked'; simple questions imply evaluation.
'Answered slowly' describes the manner of speaking.
Past tense 'came' and 'did' to describe actions by the doctor.
'Had to' shows obligation; sequence of test activity.
Simple past action describing a test task.
'After' introduces a time sequence; doctor 'spoke to us'.
Doctor's statement using 'might be' to express possibility.
'Told us not to worry' is indirect reported speech.
General advice provided with 'gave us advice'.
'Should keep' as a suggestion using modal verb.
'Gently and clearly' describe how to speak to a person with dementia.
Descriptive phrase 'smiled and said thank you' shows gratitude.
